column5: Holy shit this hits waaay to close to home. I‚Äôm PIMO right now, unable to escape because I‚Äôm not 18, and i literally can‚Äôt get help. My parents think therapy is a financial scam and that the cure for depression lies and *only* lies in the gospel and living a healthy lifestyle‚Äîthe latter may have some degree of truth but I‚Äôve tried and it doesn‚Äôt fucking fix the problem for me. Even after I‚Äôve begged for help, even after my parents watched and yelled at me while I was having convulsions on the floor during a panic attack and unable to breathe, they refuse to budge and assume that I‚Äôm actually fine and it‚Äôs just a phase. Damn I‚Äôm ranting here but the church is fucking abusive and I just had to get that off of my chest.

Oh god I remember filling this thing out in my first year of seminary. I was pretty TBM at the time but like any freshman ever I did stuff I "wasn't supposed to" and filling this out gave me a small panic attack when I saw what I was supposed to be doing. Instead of focusing on the talents and skills I actually had, I felt like a worthless person because I couldn't put a 5 on most of these.

It is so embarrassing! The first crack on my shelf came when I saw what temple clothing looked like and I was like ‚Äúwait no, the church I know isn‚Äôt like *that*!‚Äù I just couldn‚Äôt look at all the adults in my ward the same way because I‚Äôd think of them all wearing those silly hats and aprons and I‚Äôd start laughing.

That‚Äôs cause they changed it in 1990. Before then, in the prayer circles you would raise your hand and repeat ‚Äúpay lay ale,‚Äù which is apparently in the language that Adam spoke in the garden of eden or some shit. Now you say ‚Äúoh god, hear the words of my mouth‚Äù which is supposed to be a translated version of pay lay ale. Don‚Äôt know why they changed it, maybe sky daddy was pissed that we knew some of his super secret heaven speak?
I often say "pay lay ale, bitches!" to my nevermo friends. They think its just me being weird, but I like to imagine that some TBM overheard me and I just offended them greatly.
Ironic that satan is the only character with any life or emotion. Almost as if TSCC wants us to be a bunch of mindless obedient sheep . . . oh wait.

Music. All day, every day. It drowns out my thoughts so I don't have to hear all my internal screaming and panic. I can just sink into the music and then I don't even have to acknowledge my own existence.

I think more people are understanding that it's a legitimate sexuality, separate from gay or straight. And yeah, the world is becoming more LGBT+ in general. For example, I'm in hs right now and there is a significant LGBT+ student population in my school who are more or less treated the same as other students. People aren't being pressured to conform to heteronormativity anymore, which is a step in the right direction for society.

This perfectly summarizes why the prequel trilogy had so much better of an impact on SW that the sequels. Heck, almost half of the SW lore comes from these movies, and the aesthetic of the prequels became a mainstay in the EU and the franchise in general. And of course that‚Äôs not even considering the fact that the prequels spawned the clone wars, which is the absolute peak of Star Wars imo.

Yes, manga > anime imo. And if you do start reading, I would recommend reading the whole thing from chapter 1. The uprising arc (season 3 part 1) had a lot of things cut from the manga, leaving out pieces of character development, especially for Levi, Historia, and Erwin. Also, Grisha and Kruger‚Äôs conversation at the end of season 3 was condensed, leading to some key information about Marley being cut. To get the full story you need to read through the whole manga.
